problem_text:
Is there a function f : N →N such that, for every soluble group G of derived length k generated by a set A, the validity of the identity x^4 = 1 on each subgroup generated by at most f(k) elements of A implies that G is a group of exponent 4?
V. V. Bludov
answer: No, there is not (G. S. Deryabina, A. N. Krasil’nikov, Siberian Math. J., 44, no. 1 (2003), 58–60).
